div.head: CHAP. XXII.
1 Eliphaz sheweth that mans goodnesse profiteth not God. 5 Hee accuseth Iob of diuers sinnes. 21 He exhorteth him to repentance, with promises of mercy.
div.ab: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered, and said,
Can a man be profitable vnto God? as hee that is wise may be profitable vnto himselfe. Or, if hee may be profitable, doth his good successe depend thereon?
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gaine to him, that thou makest thy waies perfite?
Will hee reproue thee for feare of thee? will he enter with thee into iudgment?
Is not thy wickednesse great? and thine iniquities infinite?
For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing. Heb. stripped the clothes of the naked.
Thou hast not giuen water to the wearie to drinke, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
But as for the mightie man, hee had the earth, and the honourable man dwelt in it. Heb. the man of arme , Heb. eminent or accepted for countenance.
Thou hast sent widowes away emptie, and the armes of the fatherlesse haue bene broken.
Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden feare troubleth thee,
Or darkenes that thou canst not see, and abundance of waters couer thee.
Is not God in the height of heauen? and behold the height of the starres how high they are. Heb. the head of the starres.
And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he iudge through the darke cloude? Or, what.
Thicke cloudes are a couering to him that he seeth not, and hee walketh in the circuit of heauen.
Hast thou marked the olde way which wicked men haue troden?
Which were cut downe out of time, whose foundation was ouerflowen with a flood. Heb. a flood was powred vpon their foundation.
Which said vnto God, Depart from vs, and what can the Almightie doe for them? Chap. 21. 14. , Or, to them
Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsell of the wicked is farre from me. Chap. 21. 16.
The righteous see it, and are glad, and the innocent laugh them to scorne. Psal.107. 42.
Whereas our substance is not cut downe, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth. Or, estate. , Or, their excellencie.
Acquaint now thy selfe with him, and be at peace: thereby good shal come vnto thee. That is, with God.
Receiue, I pray thee, the Lawe from his mouth, and lay vp his words in thine heart.
If thou returne to the Almightie, thou shalt be built vp, thou shalt put away iniquitie farre from thy tabernacles. Chap.8. 5.
Then shalt thou lay vp golde as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brookes. Or on the dust.
Yea the Almightie shall bee thy defence, and thou shalt haue plenty of siluer. Or, gold. , Heb. siluer of strength.
For then shalt thou haue thy delight in the Almightie, and shalt lift vp thy face vnto God.
Thou shalt make thy prayer vnto him, and he shall heare thee, and thou shalt pay thy vowes.
Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shal be established vnto thee: and the light shall shine vpon thy wayes.
When men are cast downe, then thou shalt say, There is lifting vp: and he shall saue the humble person. Heb. him that hath lowe eyes.
He shall deliuer the Iland of the innocent: and it is deliuered by the purenesse of thine hands. Or, the innocent shall deliuer the Iland.
